channel.title: Project Awesomeness and other 562 clients wont connect
channel.description:
Okay, so here's the deal.
I'm running 562 servers off of my computer, with no-ip installed and running. I can get the client to connect if I use localhost IP only. When I go to change my IP to the no-ip.org extension, or just using my external ip, the client will not connect. Constantly gets stuck at "Connecting to Update Server" and then gives me an "error_game_js5connect".
I have tried this on a 317 server as well, with the exact same results. Router/modem through xfinity, and IS port forwarded to 43594 AND 43595 with both TCP/UDP listed. What am I doing wrong? I have searched everywhere for a fix, including here and google. Noone seems to have this fixed, and I never used to have a problem with this a couple of years ago when I used CorruptionX server source/client downloaded from here.
Please help, on a bit of a deadline.
:::EDIT:::
I have teamviewer if that'll help solve the situation faster. Please lemme know.
:::EDIT:::
If noone wants to help, just delete this topic. I'm actually trying to figure this out, but even with 5 reads, and all the experienced coders out there with more knowledge than myself, I find it pretty sad that my post gets overlooked like I'm just pathetic.

item.title: Project Awesomeness and other 562 clients wont connect
item.dc:creator: @phoenixrising phoenixrising
item.description:
@phoenixrising wrote:

Okay, so here’s the deal.

I’m running 562 servers off of my computer, with no-ip installed and running. I can get the client to connect if I use localhost IP only. When I go to change my IP to the no-ip.org extension, or just using my external ip, the client will not connect. Constantly gets stuck at “Connecting to Update Server” and then gives me an “error_game_js5connect”.

I have tried this on a 317 server as well, with the exact same results. Router/modem through xfinity, and IS port forwarded to 43594 AND 43595 with both TCP/UDP listed. What am I doing wrong? I have searched everywhere for a fix, including here and google. Noone seems to have this fixed, and I never used to have a problem with this a couple of years ago when I used CorruptionX server source/client downloaded from here.

Please help, on a bit of a deadline.

:::EDIT:::

I have teamviewer if that’ll help solve the situation faster. Please lemme know.

:::EDIT:::

If noone wants to help, just delete this topic. I’m actually trying to figure this out, but even with 5 reads, and all the experienced coders out there with more knowledge than myself, I find it pretty sad that my post gets overlooked like I’m just pathetic.
